item.title: Louvre | France to reinforce security at cultural sites after theft
item.description: The French Minister of Internal Affairs, Laurent Nuñez, will reinforce security measures in all cultural establishments, the press office announced yesterday, following a jewelry theft at the Louvre Museum in Paris. The decision was taken after a meeting with his government colleague in charge of Culture, Rachida Dati, said the same ministerial source, cited by the French news agency AFP. The institution, in the center of the French capital, remained closed yesterday, one day after a group, still at large, managed to steal multiple works of jewelry art. "The Louvre Museum will remain closed today (yesterday) for exceptional reasons. We apologize for the inconvenience", read a message published on the museum's official website. A group of four men stole jewelry on Sunday morning, in just a few minutes and when the museum was already open and with visitors inside, using a forklift machine, parked on the respective bank of the River Seine, and raising it to the height of a window on the first floor of the building. The group took eight pieces “of inestimable heritage value”, including the tiara of Empress Eugenie (wife of Napoleon III, emperor from 1852 to 1870) and two necklaces, the French Ministry of Culture reported on Sunday. That jewel alone has 212 pearls and 1,998 diamonds, according to the Louvre's description, while the pieces belonging to Queen Maria Amélia have multiple sapphires and hundreds of diamonds. This Parisian museum is the largest and most visited in the world, with nine million people enjoying part of the 35,000 works that the institution houses, in its 73 thousand square meters of space.

item.title: Cuts leave 13.7 million people at risk of extreme hunger
item.description: Cuts in humanitarian aid funding could expose up to 13.7 million people to extreme hunger around the world, the World Food Program (WFP) warned yesterday. “The humanitarian aid system is under severe pressure as partners withdraw from frontline areas, creating a void,” the Rome-based agency said in a new report titled “A lifebuoy in danger.” The UN agency said that six of its operations – in Afghanistan, the Democratic Republic of Congo, Haiti, Somalia, South Sudan and Sudan – are “facing major disruptions, which will only worsen”. WFP warned that its financing “has never been so challenging”, anticipating “a 40 percent drop” in 2025, “which will translate into a projected budget of US$6.4 billion, compared to US$10 billion in 2024”. The report does not name any countries, but points to a study published in the medical journal The Lancet, which found that 14 million additional deaths worldwide from disease, nutritional deficiencies and maternal and perinatal conditions could occur by 2030 as a result of cuts in US humanitarian aid alone. Returns and records Since US President Donald Trump's return to the White House, Washington has announced massive cuts in its foreign aid, dealing a huge blow to humanitarian operations around the world. "Program coverage has been significantly reduced and rations cut. Vital assistance to families in food disaster situations [Phase 5 of the Integrated Food Security Phase Classification/IPC] is threatened, while preparedness for future impacts has significantly decreased," warns WFP. Globally, “WFP estimates that its funding gaps could push 10.5 to 13.7 million people currently in acute food insecurity (IPC Phase 3) into a humanitarian emergency (IPC Phase 4),” the organization added. The UN agency said global hunger has now reached record levels, with 319 million people facing acute food insecurity — including 44 million at emergency levels.

item.title: Death | António Coelho dies aged 77, but leaves a legacy in Portuguese gastronomy
item.description: The founder of Restaurante António died on Sunday in Macau, due to heart problems. Behind him, he leaves a mark and an innovative concept for promoting Portuguese food in Asia A father, a friend and one of the great ambassadors of Portuguese gastronomy in Asia. Chef António Coelho died on Sunday, aged 77, due to heart problems, but leaves behind a professional career spanning almost 40 years and an influence that can be felt in several restaurants and Portuguese food chefs in Macau. Born in Portugal in 1948, António Coelho's first contact with Macau took place in 1970, when he had to complete his four-year mandatory military service. After two years, the land remained in his memory, but the future chef chose to return to Europe. In Portugal, he started working at Social Security, later moving to a clinical analysis laboratory. It was in this area that he developed his taste for gastronomy, not through work, but through various lunches and dinners in different restaurants. Increasingly interested in cooking, António decided to take a job, in 1984, in a restaurant, where he admitted to having learned to cook, according to an interview with the South China Morning Post newspaper, in 2018. The first years of António Coelho's new career were spent in Portugal, where he performed different roles as manager-administrator of the Botequim do Rei restaurant or director of the catering department at the Grande Hotel da Curia. In 1996, he had his first international experience, as director of the restaurant department at the Hotel Trópico, in Cape Verde. The experience lasts one year. Creating a legacy Returning to Macau in 1997, António worked for 10 years in different spaces, such as the restaurants Frol de la Mar, Lusitano, Lisbon, and also had a brief stay in Hong Kong, in 2002, at Restaurante Inn. However, the decisive step towards his affirmation as one of the most influential chefs of Portuguese gastronomy in Asia came in 2007, with the opening of Restaurante António. And the success that followed was not the result of chance, as said by Edgar Rodrigues, a chef who came to Macau to work on the launch of the project: “The success was based on the recipes, the quality of the food, but also the very professionalism”, says Edgar Rodrigues, to HM. "He was very attentive to his customers. If there was an order for clams à bolhão pato, he would have different recipes adapted to the nationality. For example, Koreans don't like coriander, the recipe for them didn't have coriander. Chinese customers like little salt, they were served with little salt, and locals like the more traditional recipe. In a single dish there were several ways of cooking, just to satisfy different customers", he recalls. Cristiano Tavares, currently chef at the Macalhau restaurant, also came to Macau to work at the António Restaurant. He believes that the chef found a position for Portuguese food that still influences other restaurants today. “I think his success was due to his way of being, he was a politically correct person, he had a way of working that pleased both Chinese, Korean and Japanese tourists”, explained Cristiano Tavares, to HM. "We were a street restaurant with four or five cooks. He managed to do what many large restaurants still cannot do today. Nowadays there are many restaurants with Portuguese food that open in Macau, but follow the example of what he did", he considered. Quality and spectacle In addition to the food, Restaurante António customers were seduced by the “show”. This is the vision of Marcelino Marques, António's friend and musician who for several years livened up the space's nights, with traditional Portuguese music. "The quality of the food made the space popular. He took great care in choosing the food and drinks served. He went to Portugal to choose wines from various regions, such as Douro or Alentejo, all of high quality, which were bottled under the António brand. People knew they weren't going to pay little, not that it was a space with luxury prices, it wasn't, but the quantity served wasn't small", recalled Marcelino Marques. However, the musician believes that the success was also due to a concept in which the meal was also a spectacle: "People liked listening to Portuguese music, but also being with António. He was an affable, big person and appeared in that white jacket with the flags of Portugal, China and Macau and people liked his presence and asked him to take photographs", he says. "He also opened a bottle of champagne with a sword. He did a whole ceremony and people really liked it. It was a spectacle and a party to see the cork flying out of the bottle. It worked well", he recalled. Marcelino Marques recalls that the food and the show made the restaurant very famous, especially among Japanese, Korean and Hong Kong tourists. The musician reveals that Japanese tourists booked days in advance. And this factor also contributed to the fact that António offered a glass of port wine at the end of the meal, which also led to the recognition of the Port Wine Confraternity. The success of Restaurante António led the chef to sell the space to an investment fund, becoming an ambassador for the space. The break with the fund happened in 2020, when he was fired without just cause. The case ended up in court, with António winning the case. In recent years, António took on the position of executive chef at Angela’s Café and Lounge, at the Hotel Lisboeta. A father, a friend Due to his work in Macau, António was distinguished, in 2013, by the Macao SAR Government with the MSAR Tourist Merit Medal. Also in 2015, he received the merit medal for Portuguese communities from the Portuguese Government. However, for those who worked with him the most important thing was the relationship that went beyond the strictly professional field. "He had a big impact on Macau and for me he was like a second father. When I came to Macau I didn't have an easy life and he always held my hand", confessed Rodrigues. "He was always a person who was there for me. And I always saw him as a man of iron. In everything he did, there was a great will", he pointed out. This is a feeling shared by Cristiano Tavares. "António is my father in Macau. He worked until the last day, always with seriousness, honesty and integrity. He is an example for all the chefs in this area", he said. For Marcelino Marques, António's death is the loss of a friend. "António was the person who welcomed me to Macau and was capable of doing the same to everyone. He was strict and demanding, but he was an excellent person", he described. "Everyone knew him. He was an affable person and received people like no one else", he added.

item.title: Pop Mart, maker of Labubu, falls 10.8% in Hong Kong amid doubts about growth
item.description: Shares in Pop Mart, the Chinese company responsible for the global phenomenon of Labubu figures, sank 10.8% this Thursday, the biggest drop since April, in a new episode of volatility that contrasts with the good sales results released the day before. The devaluation reflects investors' growing caution regarding the possibility of a slowdown in the company's growth, after several quarters driven by the popularity of its collectible products. On Wednesday, Pop Mart shares rose 4.23% on the Hong Kong stock exchange, despite the negative tone of the market, following the announcement that revenue in the third quarter increased between 245% and 250%, driven by Labubu's virality on social media and the company's international expansion. According to data provided by the company, domestic sales grew 190%, while international sales soared 370%, highlighted by increases of 175% in the Asia-Pacific region, more than 740% in Europe and almost 1,270% in the United States. The strong drop recorded today is largely attributed to profit taking, after appreciation of more than 186% since the beginning of the year, and uncertainty about the sustainability of the current growth rate. The stock fell 8.1% on Tuesday, its worst performance since April, weighed down by fears of a slowdown in sales after months of euphoria. The preliminary release of results helped to temporarily dispel these concerns, but the absence of an official date for the presentation of the accounts maintains uncertainty regarding the company's future evolution. Executive chairman and founder Wang Ning expressed confidence in the long-term resilience of the Labubu character, arguing that cultural icons continue to generate revenue even after peak popularity. According to the Bloomberg agency, the explosion in demand forced the company itself to revise its internal goals upwards. If at the beginning of 2024 Pop Mart predicted a turnover of 2,800 million dollars (around 2,400 million euros), in August Wang raised this target to 4,200 million dollars (3,600 million euros), pointing to the brand's global momentum as a key factor. Founded in Beijing in 2010, Pop Mart has established itself as one of the main Asian references in the toy and collectible figures sector, combining exclusive design, limited editions and collaborations with international brands, artists and franchises. Its business model is based on so-called “surprise boxes”, which encourage repeat purchases and have created a community of fans willing to pay high premiums for rare pieces. Among its main lines is Labubu, a monster with pointy ears and a mischievous smile inspired by Norse mythology, created by Hong Kong artist Lung Ka-sing in 2015 and integrated into the company's portfolio in 2019.

item.title: Chemistry | Nobel Prize for the development of metal-organic structures
item.description: The Nobel Prize in Chemistry was awarded to Susumu Kitagawa, from Kyoto University, Richard Robson, from the University of Melbourne, and Omar M. Yaghi, from the University of California, “for the development of metal-organic structures”, the Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences announced yesterday. Susumu Kitagawa, Richard Robson and Omar Yaghi have developed a new form of molecular architecture – metal-organic frameworks – that can be used to collect water from desert air, capture carbon dioxide, store toxic gases or catalyze chemical reactions. The three laureates created molecular constructs with large spaces through which gases and other chemicals could flow. The president of the Nobel Committee for Chemistry, Heiner Linque, highlighted precisely the fact that these “metal-organic structures have enormous potential, bringing previously unforeseen opportunities for personalized materials with new functions”. The research that led to the discovery of this new form of molecular architecture began nearly four decades ago, in 1989, when Richard Robson tested the use of the inherent properties of atoms by combining positively charged copper ions with a four-armed molecule. When combined, they bonded "to form a spacious, well-ordered crystal. It was like a diamond filled with countless cavities," the academy explains. Robson immediately realized the potential of his molecular construction, but it was still unstable and crumbled easily. It was chemists Susumu Kitagawa and Omar Yaghi who managed to provide a solid foundation for this construction method. Notable applications Following the discoveries of the three laureates, chemists built tens of thousands of different MOFs. Some of them could contribute to solving some of humanity's biggest challenges, with applications including breaking down traces of pharmaceuticals in the environment, capturing carbon dioxide or collecting water from desert air. The discovery also allows the separation of perfluoroalkylated and polyfluoroalkylated substances (PFAS) from water. PFAS are a group of synthetic chemical compounds known as “forever chemicals” due to their extreme persistence in the environment and in the human body. PFAS are used in a wide range of industrial and household products, such as stain- and water-resistant textiles, food packaging, non-stick cookware and firefighting foams. Its accumulation in the environment and potential health risks, including liver damage and other problems, have led to concerns and a search for safer alternatives.

item.title: Study | Trump was the main disseminator of disinformation in the USA in 2024
item.description: North American President Donald Trump was the main disseminator of disinformation in the United States of America (USA) in 2024, concluded a study by the International Center for Journalists (ICFJ). “US President Donald Trump was the dominant source and distributor of disinformation” in 2024, say the authors of the study “Disarming Disinformation: United States”. The study highlights that Trump has drawn on the functions of domestic political forces, rather than foreign state actors, as the main source of disinformation narratives in US political discourse. Furthermore, the existence of WhatsApp groups and other closed digital spaces often act as “information cocoons” that encourage rumors and other forms of misinformation. In this way, "the viral spread of misinformation and the strategic attack on journalists have emerged as interconnected threats to democracy. In an era of increasing authoritarianism and democratic backsliding, falsehoods are often used as a weapon by state actors to influence public opinion, undermine journalism and intimidate journalists." The study authors state that these factors are increasingly the North American reality, with Donald Trump “promulgating manifestly false narratives” in recent years. “The American media faces a profound information crisis, at a time of repression of freedom of expression”, the study reads. In this sense, trust in the mainstream press continues to decline in a climate of increasing attacks on the media by the Trump Government. The study published by the International Center for Journalists (ICFJ) was based on the analysis of 10,000 news and media publications during 2024, as well as a survey of 1,020 Americans.

item.title: Scientists ‘reduce’ the age of the Egyptian temple of Karnak, in Egypt
item.description: Researchers have carried out the most comprehensive geoarchaeological study of the Karnak temple, near Luxor, and revealed suggestive links to ancient Egyptian mythology and new data about the interaction between the complex's riverine landscape and the people who occupied the site during its almost 3,000 years of use. The results of the investigation were published on Monday in Antiquity magazine, reported the Efe news agency. Researchers from the University of Southampton, in the United Kingdom, and Uppsala University, in Sweden, participated in the study. Up to 61 sediment samples from the interior and surroundings of the temple and thousands of ceramic fragments found in the Karnak complex, located 500 meters east of the current Nile River, near Luxor, in the ancient Egyptian religious capital of Thebes, were analyzed. The researchers mapped how the landscape around the site changed throughout its history and found that, before 2520 BC, the site could not have been suitable for permanent occupation due to periodic flooding caused by the Nile's strong currents. Therefore, they placed the earliest occupation at Karnak during the Old Kingdom (between 2591 and 2152 BC). Pottery fragments found at the site corroborate this discovery, with the oldest dating between 2305 and 1980 BC. Therefore, the conclusions of this international team of researchers provide new evidence about the age of Karnak, which has been hotly debated in archaeological circles for decades. The origin of everything The ground on which the temple was founded was formed when river channels advanced west and east, creating an island of high ground in what is now the east-southeast region of the site. This emerging island laid the foundation for the occupation and initial construction of Karnak. Over the following centuries and millennia, the river channels on both sides of the site diverged further, creating more space for the development of the temple complex, as researchers have now confirmed. This new understanding of the temple's landscape bears striking similarities to an ancient Egyptian creation myth, leading the team to believe that the decision to locate the temple there may have been related to the religious views of its inhabitants. Ancient Egyptian texts from the Old Kingdom indicate that the 'Creator God' manifested himself as high ground emerging from the lake, and researchers have found that the island where Karnak was founded is the only known area of ​​high ground surrounded by water in the region. Thus, archaeologists have suggested that the Theban elites chose the location of Karnak to be the abode of a new form of 'Creator God', alluding to Amun-Ra, the supreme god of ancient Egypt, since the location fit perfectly into the mythological setting of the highlands that emerged from the surrounding waters as the origin of the formation of the Universe.

item.title: Government | Wong Sio Chak visited public services
item.description: Having recently taken office as Secretary for Administration and Justice, Wong Sio Chak recently visited several public services under his authority, in order to find out how they work. Since October 16th, when he took office, he has visited the Directorate of Justice Affairs Services (DSAJ), the Institute for Municipal Affairs (IAM), the Directorate of Administration and Public Service Services (SAFP) and the Official Press (IO), “having exchanged opinions with management and leadership staff and frontline workers”, highlights an official note. In the case of DSAJ, the visit took place on the 21st, with the secretary “taking note of the status of the work due to the merger of DSAJ with IO”, which will be formalized from this Friday. Another visit took place on Monday afternoon, with the government official, in the company of SAFP director Leong Weng In, and other leaders, visiting “the work offices of that service and meeting with management and leadership staff, to learn more about the work to promote Public Administration reform, matters relating to voter registration and public service on the front line of the Public Information Center”, among other tasks. Wong Sio Chak left several notes on these visits, namely “the strengthening of unity and cooperation” between workers and the promotion of “horizontal and positive communication, in order to unite the team’s synergy”, and should also focus on “the reformist and innovative spirit and assuming its responsibilities”.

item.title: Qinghai | Sam Hou Fai highlights tourist attraction
item.description: Sam Hou Fai highlighted the “abundant eco-tourism” resources of Qinghai province, which he said is one of the places sought after by residents. The statements are contained in a press release, following a meeting between the Chief Executive and the deputy secretary of the provincial committee of the Chinese Communist Party (PCC) and governor of Qinghai province, Luo Dongchuan, at the Government Headquarters, which took place last Monday. In addition to highlighting the tourist attractiveness of the province whose capital is Xining, Sam Hou Fai also pointed out that the two Chinese regions should reinforce their focus on tourism by “working together to explore more tourism products to achieve mutual complementarity of advantages and common development”. At the meeting, Sam Hou Fai indicated that Macau is a “precision interlocutor” between China and Portuguese-speaking countries and that it can “actively play the role of a service platform for commercial cooperation”. The Chief Executive thus showed the Macao SAR as a platform to “help Qinghai's characteristic products to explore more promotion and sales channels within Portuguese-speaking countries”.

item.title: HK / Elections | John Lee praises Macau model and promises to follow it
item.description: The Chief Executive of the neighboring region confirmed that he sent representatives to Macau to learn from the experience of the September Legislatures. John Lee also confirmed that he sent letters to civil servants indicating that voting is a proof of loyalty to the Basic Law and the HKSAR The Chief Executive of Hong Kong promised to follow the Macau model in the next elections for the Legislative Council. John Lee praised the measures in Macau, where public servants were warned that abstention in Legislatures could be understood as a lack of patriotism, and some heads of Public Administration departments prepared questionnaires about their subordinates' voting intentions. “I have already asked all public services to take all possible measures so that employees who need to work on voting day can travel to the polling stations in a convenient way,” said the leader of the Hong Kong Government. Like Sam Hou Fai, John Lee admitted that he also sent a letter to civil servants indicating that participation in the elections is taken as proof of loyalty to the Basic Law and the HKSAR. Unlike what happened in Macau, at first, John Lee's letter was publicly released. In the letter, the Chief Executive indicates that public servants need to be an example of civic responsibility, which they should do when voting. However, John Lee did not clarify, similar to what happened in Macau, whether he will penalize public servants who choose not to go to the polls. Messages to companies The leader of the Hong Kong Government also publicly acknowledged that as a way of preparing the Legislatures, several representatives of his Government were in Macau, where they met with local government officials, to learn about the model. John Lee gave a very positive assessment of this exchange, which he explained by considering that the elections in the Macao SAR were “carried out successfully”. However, the HKSAR Government's efforts do not stop at just mobilizing public servants. As happened in Macau, where some concessionaires and state-owned companies questioned workers about their intention to vote and arranged transport, in Hong Kong it is intended that private companies will also mobilize workers. “I also appeal to all private and public entities, organizations and companies to encourage their employees to vote, with appropriate measures”, can be read in the letter made public. Despite this plan, the Chief Executive of Hong Kong did not set a target for voter participation. "We don't have any rigid indicators, but we will do our best. That's our indicator", said John Lee. In the Macau Legislature, the participation rate was 53.35 percent, the third lowest since the transition of sovereignty.

item.title: Administration | Nick Lei accuses managers of incompetence
item.description: Deputy Nick Lei accused several public service managers of not having “knowledge” for the functions they perform and treating their positions as “feudal states”. The accusation by the deputy linked to the Fujian community was made during the intervention before the agenda of the Legislative Assembly plenary. In an intervention in which he called for a reform of the laws that regulate Public Administration, Nick Lei indicated that “in the face of internal and external changes, the challenges of economic development and the growing needs of society in the context of public services” it is necessary to implement changes, to achieve “practical and viable results for residents”. Law later defended that “the lack of clarity regarding the powers and responsibilities of public services, the lack of interdepartmental coordination, the complexity of administrative procedures, the irresponsible attitude of the services, the action of each one in their own way and the outdatedness of some laws and regulations”, shows that “many leaders do not have sufficient knowledge about the services they provide, and that, in addition, bureaucracy and “feudal states” continue to constitute obstacles to increasing government efficiency and promoting development socio-economic”. In this sense, the deputy asked that Xi Jinping's speeches be followed and that the Government move forward with changes in the face of the obstacles that impede its own development.

item.title: Labor Rights | Leong Pou U debuts with orders
item.description: Deputy Leong Pou U made his debut in the Chamber calling on the Executive to update several labor rights, which have not undergone any changes for more than 30 years. “In reality, Macau's labor standards are always behind those of neighboring countries and regions, despite having a socioeconomic development similar to that of Macau, [...] and some labor standards have not been updated for decades”, began by stating the deputy linked to the Operários. “For example, working hours and annual holidays have not been changed since 1984, that is, 41 years; mandatory holidays have not been adjusted for 36 years, since 1989”, he pointed out. Based on these data, the deputy elected indirectly called on the Executive to move forward as quickly as possible with the “systematic review and improvement of labor laws and regulations, taking into account the real situation and the development trend of the Macau labor market”. Despite this request, Leong Pou U defended the need for a consensus between employers and workers to implement changes, which rarely happens, even within the Permanent Council for Social Concertation (CPCS).

item.title: AL | Leaders of work committees defined
item.description: José Chui Sai Peng will assume the presidency of the Rules and Mandates Committee, one of the most important committees. O português José Pereira Coutinho é o deputado mais experiente, mais velho e foi o “rei dos votos” no sufrágio directo, mas nem assim foi escolhido para qualquer cargo de liderança On Tuesday, deputies chose the compositions and presidencies of the Legislative Assembly's working committees. Legislator and businessman José Chui Sai Peng will assume the presidency of the Rules and Mandates Committee, which is particularly important as it has the power to suggest changes to the legislative body's operating rules. For the cousin of the former Chief Executive, Fernando Chui Sai On, the presidency of a committee is nothing new, given that in the previous Legislature he led the Monitoring Committee for Public Land and Concessions Affairs. In relation to the secretary of the Rules and Mandates Committee, the choice of deputies fell on the lawyer and academic Iau Teng Pio. With regard to the permanent work committees, the 1st Committee will be led by Wong Kit Cheng, a nurse by training and Women's deputy. The secretary will be Nick Lei Leong Wong. Wong also has experience in leading committee work, as in the previous Legislature he led the Monitoring Committee for Public Finance Matters. In the 2nd Commission, the presidency was handed over to Ip Sio Kai, vice-president of the Bank of China (Macau), while the vice-presidency went to Lam Lon Wai, from the Workers' Party. In the 3rd Commission, the person chosen for president was Leong Sun Iok, also a Workers' deputy, while the secretary will be Leong Hong Sai, linked to the Residents. Lots of follow-up As for the monitoring committees, they also underwent several changes. In the Monitoring Committee for Land Affairs and Public Concessions, the presidency was attributed to Ella Lei Cheng I. In the previous Legislature, the Workers' deputy was the president of the 1st Permanent Committee. The secretary will be Joey Lao Chi Ngai, returned to the hemicycle, after being passed over as a legislator appointed by the Chief Executive by Ho Iat Seng. In the Monitoring Committee for Public Finance Affairs, Song Pek Kei will assume the presidency, while Ngan Iek Hang will serve as vice president. Finally, at the level of the Monitoring Committee for Public Administration Affairs, businessman Ma Chi Seng will be responsible for the presidency, with Kou Kam Fai as secretary. The presidency of the Administrative Council of the Legislative Assembly, which deals with matters such as the hemicycle's budget, was handed over to Ângela Leong On Kei. The committees' choices also confirm that José Pereira Coutinho was excluded from any leadership position despite being the most experienced deputy in the hemicycle, the oldest and also the one who was the “king of votes” in direct suffrage.

item.title: Kiang Wu | Association received 234.14 million patacas
item.description: The Kiang Wu Hospital Charitable Association received almost 9 out of every 10 patacas distributed in support by the Health Services in the third quarter. In total, 270.35 million patacas were allocated in subsidies The Kiang Wu Hospital Charity Association received 234.14 million patacas in subsidies paid by the Health Services, which in the third quarter of this year totaled 270.35 million patacas. The data was revealed last week, and means that for every 10 patacas distributed by the SS in support, practically nine end up deposited in the private hospital's accounts. The main supports were declared as “subsidy for the inpatient service”, referring to different months of the year, in a total of four subsidies. All of this support for the inpatient service amounted to more than 40 million patacas, with the highest amount being reached in May, with a tranche of 43.04 million patacas. In March, the amount was 41.74 million patacas, in July it dropped to 41.36 million patacas and in April it was 40.21 million patacas. These transfers represented 166.35 million patacas of the total 234.14 million received by the institution. The second largest type of support granted by the Health Services to Kiang Wu was due to the “protocol subsidy to finance the medical expenses of cardiac patients”. As part of this support, four monetary tranches were paid, corresponding to four months. In March, financing of medical expenses for cardiac patients reached the highest value, with a total of 12.70 million patacas. In May, the value was 9.87 million patacas, while in April it was 7.68 million patacas and in June 7.48 million patacas. Other smaller supports involved subsidizing the operation of the Hong Ling Center, expenses with examination services for cervical cancer screening, external vaccination consultations and subsidizing audit expenses for the Kiang Wu School of Nursing for the year 2023. Regular customers As for the associations supported by the SS, the Federation of Workers' Associations of Macau (FAOM) received 18.37 million patacas, with the majority of the subsidies going to the rehabilitation nursing services of the Recovery Center. The SS granted the center three tranches of 4.57 million patacas, for the operation of the center in the months of July, August and September. Other support to FAOM aimed at “providing external consultation services”, with monthly support amounting to just over 1 million patacas. On the podium of the most supported institutions, the Tong Sin Tong Charitable Association also appears, receiving 9.48 million patacas. Among this support, the largest share was justified with the “provision of external consultation and treatment services” in the months of September, August and July. In all periods there was a fixed subsidy of 3.08 million patacas. However, there was also other smaller support, with subsidies of around 50 thousand patacas officially justified with a “fissure sealant program”. List of institutions The distribution of the 270.35 million patacas by the SS covered 12 local institutions. In the list, it is possible to find other associations such as Santa Casa da Misericórdia de Macau, which received around 103 thousand patacas, and Cáritas de Macau, to which 315 thousand patacas were distributed. In the case of these two institutions, the support was due to the provision of medical care in local nursing homes. The names of the supported institutions also include the New Chinese Youth Association of Macau, which received 5.17 million patacas, to support the recovery center in providing external consultations or cancer screening. This association also received a subsidy of 160 patacas, the lowest of those awarded, related to HIV virus screening tests.

item.title: Global Strategic Triangle (II)
item.description: “Winning the AI ​​race will usher in a new golden age.” U.S. Defense Innovation Board, 2023 After the United States, Russia is the only major power with deep blood ties to Israel. The diaspora of Jews from the post-Soviet space, which began more than four decades ago, has allowed Moscow to have a community of around one million Russians living in Israeli territory, many of them integrated into the elites. Communication between Netanyahu and Putin is direct and functional. In the Kremlin, there are those who welcome the eventual rise of Naftali Bennett, a Jew of American origin and informal mediator in the Russian-Ukrainian negotiations in 2022, interrupted by external pressure. In this context, the possibility of Israel expanding its current seven theaters of war is not remote. The accelerated erosion of internal balance in the triangle with Iran and Turkey weakens the region's geopolitical buffers. The physical distance of almost two thousand kilometers that separates Israel from Iran becomes increasingly irrelevant, as tension between the two regimes intensifies, enveloped in a rhetoric of mutual demonization. The crisis in the strategic corridor that connects Herat to Beirut, passing through Tehran, Baghdad and Damascus, fuels the possibility of a direct confrontation. With Turkey, the playing field is different. Syria became the field for maneuver. Damascus, recently taken over by jihadist militias supported by Ankara, is dangerously close to Israeli positions beyond the Golan. A scenario of unstable balance between Turks in Aleppo and Israelis in Damascus begins to emerge. Erdogan, with long-term ambitions, dreams of the symbolic reconquest of Jerusalem and the Al-Aqsa Mosque, in a future in which Israel does not exist. Although Tel Aviv does not admit it, the real strategic challenge lies not in Iran, weakened and in survival mode, but in Turkey, whose neo-imperial vision extends from the Middle East to North Africa. Pragmatism could lead Israel to seek rapprochement with Tehran to contain Ankara, whose expansion is more tangible and threatening. The mosaic of rivalries in the Middle East appears to be contained, but its merger with the Ukrainian conflict via the Caucasus or the Black Sea is not a hypothesis to be ruled out. The cross-analysis of the three major war scenarios leads to three conclusions. The first, that of possible peace, will always be imperfect and can only be born from gradual compromises between the United States and China, with Russia as a key player. It is these three powers that have the capacity to annihilate each other and, with that, put an end to life on the planet. The true leader of the century will be the one who manages to attract Moscow into his sphere, offering it the illusion of autonomy. Europe, even in its most ambitious versions, will compete for secondary places in the train led by Washington or Beijing. Middle powers with global aspirations such as Japan, India or Türkiye itself will occupy prominent positions, but always subject to an unstable balance. There is no absolute hegemony, just a dance of forces in permanent tension. Nothing that compares to the order of Vienna or the bipolar geometry of Yalta. Today's world is a ballroom where decadent aristocrats and sophisticated privateers dance under mutual surveillance, maintaining overlapping and intertwining spheres of influence. Compromise between the greats is not the end of the story, but the only way to prevent it from ending. Under this fragile truce, smaller-scale conflicts will multiply, especially between the Middle East and Africa, intermittent wars, without a plan or horizon, in forgotten territories or disputed by neighbors and distant powers. Two variables, however, escape any control: a possible confrontation between Russia and China, still remote but plausible, and a direct clash between Russia and the United States, less likely but facilitated by the proximity of contact lines in Eastern Europe, especially after the division of Ukraine. It won't be tomorrow. But the day after tomorrow might be too late. We live in a time of forced coexistence, imposed by the impossibility of a rationally conceived world war. Localized or even global conflicts may arise, as long as they remain below the nuclear threshold. (Continues)

item.title: Normal People
item.description: In 2018, a book came out that quickly became a bestseller, Normal People by Sally Rooney. In 2020, a television series inspired by the book came out, which, with the same name, also became a success. It is a story about two young people, an Irish boy and an Irish girl, from their final year of secondary school, in Sligo, in the west of Ireland, until the end of their degree at Trinity College, in Dublin. People who fall in love, who get confused and who have sex – play the game of intimacy as best they can and delve into fractured and painful issues. Rooney shows that true intimacy is not built on desire, but on the ability to manage, or allow, emotional sharing. The story is a cliché. A girl who is not popular at school, but who comes from a financially advantaged family background, and a boy who is quite popular at school and who comes from a working class background. They become sexually and emotionally involved in an affair that both brings them together and separates them. They enter the same college and continue to go back and forth between an inordinate passion and moments of incomprehension. But that's where the cliché ends, because the way we are transported to the inner worlds of emotional expression is so rich, it removes us from the usual melodrama and transports us to a reality that is better known to us: ours, with its nuances and confusions. The book is called Normal People because what it portrays is real and normal. In this story, sexual and physical consent is crossed by an emotional layer that makes it complex. Exploring questions about power, class and the erotic, the characters navigate that world, each with their own distinct capacity for emotional and financial fulfillment. Intimacy is a game of power, of who opens or closes doors to harmony. And the places the characters inhabit are close and distant at the same time, as if they were lost in harmony with one another. Marianne, despite her background, comes from a problematic family that taught her that her wishes, or her existence, were not important. And in this empty space, she offers the other space to overcome limits: she does not choose to give in; she just doesn't know how to contain it. Connell, who lives lost, not knowing where he belongs, finds in Marianne a way to integrate into a world different from his own, which challenges and confuses him. The events are recounted in the intimacy of each person's thoughts, and we see how they awaken diametrically opposed perceptions. Reality ceases to exist and perception shapes what we do and feel. And in moments of physical intimacy, the body becomes the only place where the truth manifests itself. Sex is not a climax, but a way of communicating – the only space where they can say what words could not. Eroticism, according to the author, is pure vulnerability. In this story there are no villains, no heroes, just people – some say it portrays the lives of millennials in particular, in the confusion of being with others in the current context of labor and even geopolitical instability. Sex “isn't like that with other people”, as they confess to each other, and the romance and eroticism of the story lives in these explicit moments, others silent ones. With a fragmented timeline, we follow the two characters in significant stretches over five years. The rhythm presented to us reveals another mundane fact; they are growing. The relationship between Marianne and Connell is symptomatic of the growing pains that accompany them in discovering who they are – just normal people.

item.title: Musk's billion-dollar plan (2)
item.description: Last week, we talked about Tesla's proposal to award its Executive Director, Elon Musk, 1 billion dollars in shares as a performance bonus, on condition that he achieves a series of objectives. These objectives would be: First, reverse the recent decline in car sales. Second, develop the business of selling autonomous cars, etc. After all targets are met, not only would Tesla's value and profits increase significantly, but Musk would receive huge financial compensation, thus benefiting both parties. However, as autonomous driving technology is not yet fully developed, and countries around the world will review road legislation in light of this innovation, third-party insurance coverage will also undergo changes. These factors create uncertainty and could affect Tesla. Today, we will continue to analyze the impact that the 1 billion share compensation plan will have on Tesla, Musk and shareholders. Third, Tesla's plan to manufacture 5,000 to 10,000 Optimus humanoid robots by 2025. The aim is to create robots that can replace manual workers, such as porters, domestic workers, etc. However, Optimus' technology is not yet perfected. Many AI companies are working hard to achieve this same purpose. It remains to be seen whether Tesla will be successful in its research and whether it will become the first company to dominate the robotics market. Fourth, Tesla's Shanghai Energy Storage Giga factory began production last February. The company intends to work with a single energy solutions operator that provides energy generation, storage and management services to complement the automotive, robotics, supercomputer and energy businesses. This objective requires extremely high standards for both software and hardware. Tensions between China and the United States could have consequences for the import and export of products, a factor that is beyond Tesla's control. Fifth, the fact that Musk runs several AI companies makes his attention dispersed, and some of his public statements have had an impact on Tesla's image. The performance bonus he should have received for his work in 2018 is currently under appeal and it is not yet known whether the 2025 bonus will be approved by shareholders and the courts. These are all issues that Musk must consider. In the $1 billion performance bonus plan, Musk embodies three essential qualities in a successful business tycoon. Firstly, his management of several companies demonstrates his dedication to his work and reveals effort and passion. Second, once you reach your goals, your Tesla shares will increase from 13 percent to 25 percent. By strengthening his control over the company, Musk can continue to develop the business and lead it into the next decade of prosperity, proving his commitment to future growth. Third, Musk has a deep sense of adventure and, by taking risks, creates great benefits for the company and for himself. Only by transforming Tesla into an unprecedented technological company will Musk be able to reap substantial rewards, linking his personal assets to the company's value in the long term. Tesla's board of directors hopes that this plan will ensure Musk's focus on his project over the next decade, leading the company towards business transformation and profit growth. If the investigation is successful, Tesla could generate substantial profits. Failure can nullify all investments and result in losses. Risk is the essence of business. Profits and losses are precisely the consequence of taking risks. Compared to the 8.5 billion that the company is worth and its 400 billion in profit, the 1 billion prize is just a drop in the ocean. It is not a significant amount for Tesla, but it unites the interests of the company, its shareholders and Musk, cementing a common destiny. The success of Tesla's business means increased shareholder dividends, a rise in share value and a satisfied set of shareholders. However, some of them may be afraid that Musk will not meet all the objectives proposed by the company, and that as he has more shares, the participation in the capital of these shareholders will be diluted. This plan will make it more difficult for them to pass resolutions that secure their interests in the future. In this scenario, Tesla may become unable to do without Musk, some shareholders may feel he is indispensable, but Musk may leave when his goals are achieved. We have to wait for the result of the Tesla shareholder meeting that will take place in November and see if Musk can create another legend in the business world. item.title: What this has come to
item.description: A 14-year-old minor kills his mother with his father's gun. We have become accustomed to reading sad news about children who steal their mother's jewelry for certain vices or who beat their mother or father because they don't give them money to buy drugs. Now the red line has been crossed. A minor says that “my mother bothered me a lot”, takes his father's gun and kills his mother without appeal or aggravation. What this has come to. The mother, Susana Gravato, 49 years old, was a PSD councilor at the Vagos City Council. The court has already decided to commit the minor to a closed regime and he may then remain in the same situation for another three years. The minor committed the crime in such a conscious way that, after the act, he even simulated a robbery scenario at home. When we spoke to a psychologist, she told us that the change in children's education these days is terrifying. That social networks are one of the reasons why violence is becoming commonplace and that legislation needs to change a lot with regard to access to digital. Miguel Sousa Tavares defended the gradual ban on social networks, stressing that “They are ruining our way of life”. We live in a time of education through conditioned reflex, added the psychologist, to continue highlighting "that perhaps because we are being overtaken by dogs. We live in a time where everything is the consequence of a pseudo-trauma that ignorance can easily treat and that does nothing but prolong and worsen the disease." We read Freud very early on, and we soon realized that, in Freud, almost everything revolved around frustration and repressed sex. Then, as was fashionable, we read Piaget thinking it would help us educate our children. We were wrong. Piaget educated, but he taught us. We discovered that educating children is not limited to theories, religions or fashions. Raising children, first and foremost, must be an act of love, otherwise the reverse side of the coin could be fatal. In fact, the country, once considered peaceful, was shocked to learn that a daughter tried to stab her father to death and gouge out his eyes to simply keep a house, and the next day, a 14-year-old son killed his mother with his father's hidden pistol because “his mother was boring with her schoolwork”. Right, that is to say that he immediately “killed” his father and killed himself too. Madness contaminates and so does evil. They are identical twins. The Portuguese did not want to believe that the red line had been crossed and that now children were killing their parents. A few years ago, we met José Manuel Anes, who was president of the Criminal Security and Terrorism Observatory. A man experienced in all aspects of life, security, crime and espionage. We cannot understand what education Anes gave his daughter Ana, so that she tried to stab him to death and had the “courage” to go on social media to say that she tried to kill her father because he had collaborated with the Mossad. It's incomprehensible from a daughter. José Manuel Anes had told us that the position he held was a risky one, that he was aware that one day he could be killed, but he certainly never imagined that this could happen at the hands of his own daughter Ana, who is already in prison and who confessed to the crime. Indeed, the world has changed, and for the worse in terms of the attitudes of the new generations. Parents' fault? Perhaps. However, it is still repugnant that a 53-year-old daughter takes a knife and tries to kill her father who gave her everything including an allowance until the day he was seriously attacked. What this has come to. José Manuel Anes was attacked inside his own house. Anes had been persecuted by his daughter for five years, with death threats on social media. The daughter intended for her father to put ownership of a house in Costa de Caparica in her name. Daughter Ana Anes' theory was that she would be able to sell the house and raise the money, since she would be unemployed. This is the motive behind the crime determined by the Judiciary Police investigation. Furthermore, it was because he feared that his daughter would carry out the threats that José Manuel Anes, aged 81, began living with his current wife in the house of one of her friends, in Lisbon. Anes had received a threatening message from his daughter before the day of the crime and the very next day she rang the door of the house where she was living and Anes opened it, thinking it was the delivery of a package. He was immediately thrown to the ground by his daughter, who then attacked him with several punches all over his body. Then, with a sharp object, he hit him on the head, legs, hands and abdomen, until, finally, he pressed both of his eyes with his fingers, leaving him unable to see. What a macabre scene: a daughter who tries to kill an 81-year-old father, just for the sake of money. On any given day, every month we have a father killed by a son. What this has come to… P.S. – This was my 250th column. I would like to fraternally thank Director Carlos Morais José for the invitation he made to me about five years ago to be in contact with the readers of this magnificent newspaper.

item.title: FRC | Debate on the “China-Brazil Puzzle” and the place of the Macao SAR
item.description: The Rui Cunha Foundation (FRC) presents today, starting at 6:30 pm, another debate session integrated into the “Wheel of Ideas” cycle, with the theme “The China-Brazil Puzzle: Positioning Macau’s Strategic Piece”. According to a note from the FRC, the aim of this session is “to bring together key voices to address a crucial question: how can Macau’s unique ecosystem be harnessed to facilitate, reduce risk, and add tangible value to this vital economic corridor”. Co-organized by FRC and Well Link Bank Macau, the conversation will feature four guests, namely Yuri Ribeiro, founder and CEO of “Valor da China”, a consultancy and market intelligence company exclusively dedicated to Brazil-China relations, cultural understanding and international business development, based in Guangzhou. Another guest is Alexandre Lobo, vice-rector and professor at the University of São José in Macau, presented as a “Brazilian leader in innovation, with 20 years of global experience, and who combines deep knowledge in artificial intelligence and data science, with the passion for leading transformative projects”. The range of guests is completed by Felipe Ribeiro de Assis, associate lawyer at PK Advogados, São Paulo, with a full-service office based in Brazil, where he coordinates the “Chinese Desk”, and also Rodrigo Barbosa, co-founder and commercial director of “Modular Park Brasil”, the exclusive representative of Mussini in Brazil, specialized in metallic construction. The moderator will be José Paulo Esperança, professor and director of international partnerships at the Faculty of Management of the City University of Macau. Former Dean of ISCTE Business School and Pro-Rector for International Relations and Entrepreneurship at ISCTE-IUL, Portugal, he holds a PhD in Economics from the European University Institute. He was also vice-president of the Foundation for Science and Technology between 2019 and 2022. Challenges and opportunities Today's conversation addresses the current global panorama, where, in the “world of geopolitical and economic realignment, the China-Brazil relationship presents unprecedented opportunities and complex challenges”. Therefore, “in this new scenario, Macau’s role needs to be re-examined and redefined”, he argues. In this round table, the aim is to “translate this dialogue into action, identifying real obstacles and mapping practical paths for the integration of services in Macau, transforming its latent potential into a concrete competitive advantage”, it is said.

item.title: Netflix premieres adaptation of “The Son of a Thousand Men” in November
item.description: The adaptation of the novel “The Son of a Thousand Men”, by Valter Hugo Mãe, by Brazilian director Daniel Rezende, which was shown on Monday at the International Film Festival in São Paulo, will premiere on Netflix on November 19th. According to Porto Editora, which published the novel “O Filho de Mil Homens”, the release date of the feature film was advanced by the streaming platform. The film had its official screening this Monday, at the 49th International Film Festival in São Paulo, Brazil, one of the main cinematographic events in Latin America. Starring Rodrigo Santoro, the film tells the story of Crisóstomo, a fisherman who finds a new meaning in life when he takes in Camilo (Miguel Martines), a young orphan. The relationship between them triggers a reflection on love, acceptance and the bonds that define the concept of family. Filmed in Búzios and Chapada Diamantina, the film is a co-production between Biônica Filmes and Barry Company, which focuses on a delicate and symbolic visual approach, highlights the publisher. According to Netflix, it is “a fable about loneliness, love and acceptance”, which translates the emotional strength of Valter Hugo Mãe's writing into film. The cast also includes Rebeca Jamir, Johnny Massaro, Miguel Martines, Juliana Caldas, Grace Passô, Inez Viana, Lívia Silva, Antonio Haddad and Tuna Dwek. The São Paulo film festival also showed, in its world premiere, on October 25th, the biographical documentary “De Lugar Não”, by Portuguese director Miguel Gonçalves Mendes, about Valter Hugo Mãe and his creative process, which should arrive in Portuguese cinemas in 2026. “Intimate portrait” The work paints an intimate portrait of Valter Hugo Mãe, following the writer over seven years, as he wrote the novel “A Dehumanização”, between trips to Iceland, Brazil, Portugal, Colombia and Macau, according to information from the Portuguese consulate in São Paulo. The documentary, a visual meditation on loneliness, loss and belonging, features the participation of cartoonist Laerte Coutinho and Icelandic composer Hilmar Örn Hilmarsson, mentor of bands such as Sigur Ros and Bjork, according to the exhibition's official page. The film “From nowhere” is part of the “The Meaning of Life” project, on which director Miguel Gonçalves Mendes has been working for more than a decade — a set of nine feature films, in a kaleidoscope of contemporary figures.

item.title: Wynn Macau | Snooker stars play this Friday
item.description: The gaming and hotel venture Wynn Macau brings to the territory, this Friday, a major snooker event with the promise of having two “legends” of this sport playing. These are Ronnie O’Sullivan, who was seven times world champion, and Zhao Xintong, the first Chinese and Asian player to win the World Snooker Championship. According to a statement from Wynn, the event “King of Snooker vs. 2025 World Champion – An inspiring exhibition game between snooker legends” takes place at the Wynn Macau Grand Ballroom, with “an impressive clash between the international snooker masters expected, which will certainly be a memorable sporting spectacle”. It is expected that both will be able to recreate “classic moments from previous world tournaments”, with this event being related to an initiative from last year, the “2024 Macau Snooker Masters”. Tickets for this game are now on sale, with prices ranging between MOP580 and MOP880. Macau residents are entitled to a 25 percent discount. On the same note, Wynn promises to “continue to organize world-class sporting events”, something that can help “improve the sporting environment and the development of Macau's industry, thus facilitating the complete integration of tourism with the leisure and sports industries” in the territory.

item.title: CCM | Vanessa da Mata in concert with the Macau Chinese Orchestra
item.description: Brazilian singer Vanessa da Mata takes to the stage at the Cultural Center on November 15th as part of the “Encounter in Macau – Festival of Arts and Culture between China and Portuguese-speaking Countries”. This is a special concert, announced after the first release of the program and takes place with the musical partnership of the Macau Chinese Orchestra The Cultural Institute (IC) announced this Monday that a concert will be held, on November 15th, with Brazilian singer Vanessa da Mata, who promises to bring the rhythms of Brazil and sing them alongside the Macau Chinese Orchestra (OCM). The show is part of the “Encounter in Macau – Festival of Arts and Culture between China and Portuguese-speaking Countries”, in its seventh year of existence. This event integrates a series of activities, including the Lusofonia Festival. The concert with the Brazilian singer is scheduled for 8pm, at the CCM Grand Auditorium, and tickets have been on sale since yesterday at the Enjoy Macao Ticket Office with prices varying between 200 and 400 patacas. According to a note from the IC, Vanessa da Mata is described as being “one of the most influential voices in Brazilian contemporary music”, as well as a “singer and composer recognized for her artistic versatility and the emotional strength of her works”. She is an artist with an “unmistakable voice” and a “remarkable style”, characteristics that “won over fans all over the world, making her one of the main representatives of Brazilian popular music”. Vanessa da Mata's themes combine different musical genres, namely MPB (Brazilian popular music), R&B, pop, frevo, samba and reggae. The concert on November 15th will be led by maestro Zhang Lie, music director and main conductor of the OCM, who “has led several orchestras in international performances, receiving wide acclaim from the public”. "Under her direction, OCM will perform several emblematic songs by Vanessa da Mata, specially orchestrated for this occasion. Combining the subtlety and lyricism of traditional Chinese music with the intense and colorful rhythms of Brazil, it will offer the public a transcultural and unforgettable musical experience", the IC further describes. Long career Vanessa da Mata was born in 1976 and has released eight original albums. One of the best-known songs in his long repertoire is “Boa Sorte/Good Luck”, sung alongside Ben Harper, and which achieved international recognition. In this performance in Macau, it is guaranteed that Vanessa da Mata will bring “the best of Brazilian music, intersecting on stage with the charm and sonic delicacy of OCM, promising a memorable night of different sounds”. The Brazilian singer released, in May this year, a new album, entitled “Todas Elas”, the first single of which is “Esperança”. It is a song that “proposes a reflection on the expansion of love as a whole”, it is described on the artist’s official website. Vanessa da Mata also adds that “Todas Elas” contains “more poetry” compared to previous works. "The production is mine, the songs are all mine and will have wonderful partnerships, such as Robert Glasper, Jota.pê and João Gomes. Robert is American and considered the first jazz guy in the world, a name to watch out for. A beautiful participation by João Gomes in a song I wrote, a wonderful reggae with Jota.pê", described the artist. “Todas Elas” also gives the name to the tour that the artist has on the road. Vanessa da Mata started singing as a teenager, in bars, having given up taking the so-called “vestibular”, the exam for access to higher education in Brazil, to pursue a career in music. He began to compose his songs, and meeting Chico César, at the age of 21, was essential for taking a step forward in his career. Vanessa da Mata's first album arrived in 2004, entitled “Essa Boneca Tem Manual”.

item.title: Elections | Portuguese MP filed case against Rita Santos
item.description: The information about the shelving of the investigation for electoral interference in the 2024 Legislatures in Portugal was provided by Canal Macau, which quotes Rita Santos herself. HM confirmed, however, the filing with the Public Ministry in Portugal The Public Ministry (MP) will have archived the investigation targeting Rita Santos, related to the 2024 Legislative Elections in Portugal. The complaint came from some members of the Socialist Party (PS) in Macau, based on suspicions about electoral interference by the Portuguese Communities councilor. HM confirmed, however, the filing of the case with the MP. According to Canal Macau, which cites Rita Santos, the investigation by the Portuguese MP was archived and the order containing the decision stated that “no evidence of irregularities was found” in the conduct of the target. The order to close an investigation is issued when evidence is collected that no crime has occurred, or even if there has been a crime that was not committed by the subject of the investigation. The MP also orders the investigation to be closed if it has not been possible to obtain sufficient evidence to verify the crime or who was the perpetrator. It was in March 2024 that information emerged that Rita Santos and the Macau Public Service Workers Association (ATFPM) were being investigated in Portugal. At the time, Portugal's National Elections Commission (CNE) revealed that it would forward complaints received about interference in Macau to the MP. The complainants accused Rita Santos and ATFPM of having influenced voters to vote for the Democratic Alliance, the coalition that in 2024 was made up of the Social Democratic Party, CDS – Popular Party and Popular Monarchic Party and which won these elections with 28.83 percent of the votes. Suspended mandate and local cooperation Despite claiming to have been exonerated, the case had an impact on Rita Santos' political activity. At the beginning of October 2024, the advisor to the Portuguese Communities chose to suspend her mandate, with the newspaper Plataforma stating that the suspension was intended to avoid notification of the ongoing electoral fraud investigation. In turn, Rita Santos justified the suspension with the desire to dedicate herself to the elections for the Chief Executive in Macau, which took place on October 13, 2024, and the elections for the Legislative Assembly, which took place on September 14 of this year. Until June of this year, ATFPM leaders, such as José Pereira Coutinho, guaranteed that Rita Santos would join the list competing with the legislative ones for the Legislative Assembly. However, in June, Rita Santos was left out. The Macanese justified her absence with the fact that she wanted to dedicate more time to her family. However, the retreat came just a few days after the Macau Public Prosecutor's Office announced that Rita Santos had been questioned in the Macao SAR, due to a request for cooperation from the Portuguese authorities in the face of suspected irregularities during the elections.

item.title: Housing | Carlotta Bruni regrets lack of creativity in Zone A
item.description: Architect Carlotta Bruni regrets that the public housing being built in Zone A of the New Landfills is not very creative. “What we see being built in Zone A are very repetitive projects, and this is a problem that has always existed in Macau.” Bruni speaks today about public housing at Casa Garden at another Docomomo Macau conference Taking place today at Casa Garden, starting at 6:45 pm, is the conference “The advent of collective housing in the 20th century”, with architect Carlotta Bruni, an event promoted by the Docomomo Macau association. At the Fundação Oriente headquarters in Macau, the topic of public housing and its urban functions will therefore be discussed. To HM, Carlotta Bruni regrets that the projects being built in Zone A of the New Landfills do not have the desired creativity. Asked whether Macau is building too much public housing, the architect said “not too much, but we are building it poorly”. "It's the evil, the ugly in those buildings. It's a co-responsibility of whoever designed them and whoever commissioned them", he said, regretting that Macau had lost an opportunity to innovate in this area. "The criticism I can make is the way these projects are developed. What we see now being built in Zone A are very repetitive projects, and the issue of having a repetitive project is a problem that has always existed in Macau. The fact that no one cares about having an ugly city", he highlighted. For Carlotta Bruni, this ugliness aspect of housing “is something that is quite disturbing”, because “we, architects, have a mission in the world to make beautiful things, in addition to making practical, functional things that are cheap and all that”. “When looking at Zone A, currently, I honestly have to say that there was a bit of a mistake there,” he added. “The two examples that I will discuss at the conference [Fai Chi Kei project and B10 building in Zone A] are a bit of a draw to the fact that social housing can be created in another way, with the same entities, but with more functions than the minimum indispensable.” Living in a box In today's talk, Carlotta Bruni “questions the spatial consequences of Macau's rapid urban densification, where the prioritization of gross built area led to the erosion of community space”, highlights a note about the conference. In this way, the architect will “explore how architectural design can recover public and semi-public environments through the strategic placement of volumes, layered typologies and pedestrian connectivity”, highlighting “alternative spatial models that resist conventional categorization, such as open courtyards, narrow squares and elevated public areas, offering new structures for collective engagement in high-density contexts”. Founder and director of the LBA Arquitectura & Planeamento studio, Bruni will tackle some of the team's projects, namely the public housing development in Fai Chi Kei, now demolished. "Then we proposed public areas on all floors, because in Macau it is often forgotten that, when building a 30-story building, a certain detachment from the street is created. People feel that, when they leave the street, it is no longer part of their daily experience." Carlotta Bruni regrets “the way social housing is designed in Macau, certainly with legal minimums in terms of space”. "We are designing very small apartments that then have no place where people can have a little more life. In the Fai Chi Kei building, there was, on every two floors, a very large space, with double height, so people could be outside, sit, do some exercise, for the children to meet up", he said. The Fai Chi Kei social housing neighborhood was designed by Manuel Vicente in 1977 and completed in 1981. Demolition took place in 2010. The LBA Architect & Planning studio designed the B10 social housing building in Zone A, whose construction has already been completed. There, too, the option was to create “a series of hanging gardens, with a varied location throughout the building”, creating “specific situations for each floor”, in order to build “small communities”. The official also defended to HM that there is “a certain lack of planning” in the context of the Greater Bay Area, or at least “planning requirements”. “It is up to architects to worry about creating buildings with more interesting urban interfaces, we have to make an effort to create a more dynamic and interesting city”, he pointed out.

item.title: PJ | Indicted for kidnapping and rape of lover
item.description: The Judiciary Police (PJ) announced the arrest of a 34-year-old man on suspicion of kidnapping, rape and serious harm to the physical integrity of his lover. The case took place in a local hotel, after the two began an extramarital relationship last year. According to the PJ's version, the man and woman are from the interior, where they met and began a romantic relationship. However, the most recent meeting in Macau ended with the alleged commission of several crimes. After a meeting in a restaurant on Saturday morning, the woman was blackmailed into going to the man's hotel room in Macau. If she refused, the lover threatened to reveal the relationship to her husband and his entire family. The woman eventually gave in, but when she arrived at the hotel room she was raped and kidnapped for at least an hour. After the first attack, the woman contacted her sister to ask for help and ended up being attacked, with an ashtray on her head, in addition to being strangled with a cell phone charger cable. Given his injuries, the man allowed the victim to contact his sister, who in turn alerted the police. The suspect ended up being detained by the authorities, and when questioned by the authorities he asserted his right to silence.

item.title: Light Rail | Only two in every 100 young people use transport
item.description: Poor network coverage and the distance to residential areas mean that young people rarely use the metro. Among users, the main reason is the desire to have a different experience Only 1.5 percent of young people in Macau say they use the Light Rail as their main means of transport, that is, less than two out of every 100 young people. The conclusion is part of the study prepared by the New Chinese Youth Association of Macau, the results of which were presented yesterday. Based on a survey in which 647 young residents were questioned, aged between 18 and 44, the association concluded that the Light Rail is the least used means of transport of all those available in the territory. When asked to answer about the main means of transport in Macau, around 36.6 percent of respondents admitted that they mainly use buses. Private vehicles, such as cars or motorcycles, were indicated as the main means of travel for 31.9 percent of young people, while 26.3 percent responded that they traveled mainly on foot. Only 1.5 percent of those questioned indicated the metro as their main means of transport. Despite not being the main means of transport, 58.7 percent said they had used the metro at least once in the last year. However, almost seven in ten (68.4 percent) of these respondents were infrequent users, using every three months or less regularly. The Light Rail is still considered by users as “an experience” more than a form of transport that responds to everyday needs. Regarding the reason that led young people to choose the metro, 33.9 percent said that using it was justified “just by the experience”, while 22.1 percent said they would go to a border, and 21.3 percent said they would go to large hotels. Does not heat up or cool down Regarding the quality of the service, the largest group of young users are indifferent, with 39.3 percent responding that it is “neither good nor bad”. Conversely, 39.1 percent stated that satisfaction is “good or very good”. The results presented by the association do not allow us to know the total degree of dissatisfaction, however, there were also 14.2 percent of respondents who indicated that the experience on the metro was “not satisfactory” or “not very satisfying” Among young people who do not use the metro, 46.1 percent cited the fact that the “stations are too far from their homes” as the main reason, while 35.6 percent justified their non-use due to limited network coverage and 33.3 percent indicated that the metro does not provide direct access to the places they frequent most. One of the factors that also contributes to keeping young people away is the fact that payments made through applications that use QR technology are not accepted. Around 61.7 percent stated that due to this reason they feel less desire to use this transport. Currently, the Light Metro can be used by purchasing a ticket at ticket machines, which do not accept QR Code technology, but also at physical ticket offices. Those interested can also use the Macau Pass, passing directly through the access turnstiles.

item.title: HK | Smuggling case worth 200 million dollars discovered
item.description: Shark fins, cigars, cell phones, pharmaceutical products and even donkey skin. These are the products discovered in two more smuggling cases discovered by the Hong Kong Customs Service (SA) on the 3rd and 7th of this month. According to a statement from this organization, the value of the goods is around 200 million US dollars, with two ships involved, one of them destined for river trade. This ship was destined for Macau and was caught by the authorities on October 3rd. Five containers destined for Taiwan were also inspected and were declared to be transporting frozen food. On October 7, the SA in Hong Kong realized that 150 tons of donkey skin were circulating here and not the declared food. The same statement indicates that the investigation continues and that “the possibility of arrests is not excluded”. Under Hong Kong's Import and Export Law, anyone found guilty of importing or exporting undeclared cargo is subject to a maximum fine of US$2 million and a seven-year prison sentence upon conviction. Seven cases last week Taking into account the holding of the National Games starting next month, the Customs Service (SA) wants to show service and admitted to having reinforced inspection efforts at the Portas do Cerco Border Post. As a result of these efforts, seven cases of smuggling were recorded between 21 and 25 October. According to a statement from the SA of Macau, within the scope of the seven cases, customs agents found a total of 120 old cell phones, often used to circumvent internet access limitations, 85 pieces of electronic products and 1344 grams of cigar. The smugglers involved residents of Macau and the Interior, aged between 38 and 64 years old. Those involved were fined, the SA announced, under the provisions of the foreign trade law.

item.title: Courts | Departure of Portuguese judge confirmed
item.description: Judge Rui Ribeiro will leave the Macao SAR courts starting next month. The information had been made public by Lusa, which cited the judge himself as a source, and was confirmed yesterday through an order, published in the Official Bulletin. “Judge Rui Carlos dos Santos Pereira Ribeiro is dismissed, at his request, from the position of judge of the Court of Second Instance of the Special Administrative Region of Macau […] from November 1, 2025”, the document reads. According to the news agency, Rui Ribeiro asked to return to Portugal, due to uncertainty about authorization from the Portuguese Superior Council of Judiciary (CSM) to continue in the Macao SAR. The judge has been in Macau since September 1, 2008, and in Portugal he is part of the Civil Section of the Court of Appeal of Guimarães. Last week, the president of the CSM, João Cura Mariano, showed his willingness to send more judges to Macau, despite admitting that there is also a lack of human resources in Portugal With Rui Ribeiro's departure, there is only one Portuguese judge left in Macau, Jerónimo Alberto Gonçalves Santos, who serves as president of a collective court at the Base Judicial Court (TJB). Jerónimo Santos has been in the Macao SAR courts since September 1, 2005, being part of the Intellectual Property, Competition, Regulation and Supervision section of the Lisbon Court of Appeal in Portugal.

item.title: Great Bay | Projected salary increases of 3% in Macau
